perturbation.original_text:
2.5
Bailment of Equipment. Eutectix will provide facility space for the Licensed Equipment in a Eutectix-owned or leased secure
and protected property that is restricted from unauthorized access or viewing (the “Eutectix Property”). Eutectix shall
maintain the Licensed Equipment only in such designated Eutectix Property and shall not relocate the Licensed Equipment
from such Eutectix Property without the prior written consent of Liquidmetal. Once Eutectix receives the Licensed Equipment,
Eutectix will acknowledge in writing the receipt thereof. Eutectix’s acknowledgement of receipt of the Licensed Equipment will
constitute an acknowledgement that Eutectix has received and accepted and possesses the Licensed Equipment on bailment
for the benefit of Liquidmetal and that such receipt of the Licensed Equipment is not subject to the terms and conditions of
any applicable laws pertaining to sales and/or secured transactions. The Licensed Equipment:
perturbation.changed_text:
2.5
Conditional Transfer of Equipment. Eutectix will provide facility space for the Licensed Equipment in a Eutectix-owned or leased secure
and protected property that is restricted from unauthorized access or viewing (the “Eutectix Property”). Eutectix shall
maintain the Licensed Equipment only in such designated Eutectix Property and shall relocate the Licensed Equipment
from such Eutectix Property at its own discretion without the prior written consent of Liquidmetal. Once Eutectix receives the Licensed Equipment,
Eutectix will acknowledge in writing the receipt thereof. Eutectix’s acknowledgement of receipt of the Licensed Equipment will
constitute an acknowledgement that Eutectix has received and accepted and possesses the Licensed Equipment with intent to own it in the future
for the benefit of Eutectix and that such receipt of the Licensed Equipment is subject to the terms and conditions of
any applicable laws pertaining to sales and/or secured transactions. The Licensed Equipment:
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the arrangement as a 'bailment,' which has specific legal implications regarding ownership and control. By changing 'Bailment of Equipment' to 'Conditional Transfer of Equipment' and modifying the subsequent clauses to grant Eutectix more control and imply future ownership, the contract creates a contradiction. Bailment means to return the goods to the bailor. Also, a bailee cannot move the property without the bailor's permission.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Property Law, specifically the definition and requirements for creating a bailment versus a sale or secured transaction.

perturbation.original_text:
(a) is and shall remain the sole property of Liquidmetal,
(b) shall be made available for reasonable inspection upon at least three (3) weeks prior written request by Liquidmetal, such
inspection not to occur more than once per year during the Term, to be conducted with minimal business disruption to
Eutectix and to be conducted at Liquidmetal’s sole cost and expense and
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) is and shall be considered property of Liquidmetal until the termination of the agreement, after that, it would be Eutectix's,
(b) inspection may be allowed upon mutual agreement from both parties, such
inspection not to occur more than once per year during the Term, to be conducted with minimal business disruption to
Eutectix and to be conducted at Liquidmetal’s sole cost and expense and
perturbation.explanation: In a bailment, the bailor (Liquidmetal) retains sole ownership and has a right to inspect the property. By stating the property's ownership will change and restricting Liquidmetal's right to inspect, it contradicts the fundamental characteristics of bailment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Property Law, specifically elements of bailment.

perturbation.original_text:
(f)
perform no act or omission inconsistent with Liquidmetal’s sole ownership of the Licensed Equipment, nor attempt to
sell, assign, loan, donate, mortgage, pledge or in any other manner permit the Licensed Equipment to be encumbered;
perturbation.explanation: The original language strictly prohibits Eutectix from actions conflicting with Liquidmetal's ownership. The revised language implies Eutectix can act as if the licensed equipment were its own. The revised text contradicts the bailment structure by allowing actions inconsistent with it, such as encumbering the property during the agreement's term, thus deviating from bailment principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Property Law, specific obligations in a bailment agreement, prohibiting the bailee from acting against the bailor's ownership rights.
